fields.Title of Presentation: Calculus Students' Ideas about Functions: Identifying Opportunities to Support Teacher Learning
fields.Conference / Meeting Name: Poster presented at the 38th Annual Conference of the North American Chapter of the International Group for the Psychology of Mathematics Education
fields.Sponsoring Organization: North American Chapter of the International Group for the Psychology of Mathematics Education
fields.Description/Abstract: In this paper, we describe the first phase of a study exploring the use of video-based instructional modules to develop prospective secondary mathematics teachers’ ability to work with students’ mathematical ideas. One-on-one interviews with calculus students were conducted to capture a range of ideas about solving function-related tasks.  Analysis resulted in identifying video segments that afford opportunities for teachers to learn about teaching functions.
